titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the U.S.S. Jamestown logbook, 1882 MS 234
titlestmt.author: Patricia Ladd

publicationstmt.publisher: Woodson Research Center, Rice University, Houston, Texas

note.p: Stored onsite at the Woodson Research Center.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2022-04-01 19:26:27 -0500.

did.head: Collection Summary

repository.corpname: Woodson Research Center, Rice University, Houston, Texas

did.abstract: Journal of a Pacific cruise of the U.S.S. Jamestown from January to June 1882 kept by midshipman J. H. Gibbons

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: John H. Gibbons was one of ten midshipmen aboard the U.S.S. Jamestown during its 1882 cruise.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This logbook contains entries of the daily routine and observations made by midshipman John H. Gibbons during the 1882 cruise of the U.S.S. Jamestown from San Francisco, California to Newport, Rhode Island as well as detailed descriptions of the ship and its decks. Also contains a photo of the U.S.S. Jamestown.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: This material is open for research.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Stored onsite at the Woodson Research Center.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: Permission to publish from the U.S.S. Jamestown logbook, MS 234, must be obtained from the Woodson Research Center, Fondren Library, Rice University.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: This collection was purchased from Cedric Robinson in 1955 with the Friends' fund (Whittington gift).

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: U.S.S. Jamestown logbook, 1882, MS 234, Woodson Research Center, Fondren Library, Rice University.

odd.head: General Note
odd.p: Portions of this collection are available online at: https://scholarship.rice.edu/handle/1911/35678

did.unittitle: Journal and log of USS Jamestown from San Fransisco, California to Newport Rhode Island
